meanings.definition: Causing or capable of causing intoxication
meanings.sent1: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was intoxicating.
meanings.sent2: The music at the concert was so intoxicating that everyone danced.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog was intoxicatingly funny.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an intoxicating spell, captivating everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with an intoxicating blend of colors.

meanings.definition: Exciting or exhilarating to the point of being overwhelming
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster ride was truly intoxicating.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling movie had an intoxicating effect on the audience.
meanings.sent3: The idea of skydiving was both terrifying and intoxicating.
meanings.sent4: Her performance on stage was an intoxicating display of talent.
meanings.sent5: The view from the mountaintop was absolutely intoxicating.
